Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- href="/2019/03/15/movies/captain-marvel-goose.html">The ‘Captain Marvel’ Cat Was Actually Four Cats. Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- The dismissal prompted an outcry from the film franchise’s cast and fans.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Brooks Barnes</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-15cbhtu"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-k4k3gl e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/14mustang-1-thumbLarge.jpg 150w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo225-v2.jpg 225w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo440-v2.jpg 440w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/merlin_151806804_7fbe8b4e-aa8e-40dc-ab1a-fb27c0f8002c-hpSmall.jpg 163w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Focus Features</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-1eh6jm1 e134j7ei0"><a href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html">‘The Mustang’ Review: Where the Wild Things Roam. And Sometimes Break Out.</a></h2><p class="css-l8q78b e134j7ei1">This film is a seductively heartfelt melodrama about a violent inmate and a wild horse, brought together in a rehabilitation program to gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- href="/2019/03/15/movies/captain-marvel-goose.html">The ‘Captain Marvel’ Cat Was Actually Four Cats. Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- The dismissal prompted an outcry from the film franchise’s cast and fans.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Brooks Barnes</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-15cbhtu"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-k4k3gl e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/14mustang-1-thumbLarge.jpg 150w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo225-v2.jpg 225w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo440-v2.jpg 440w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/merlin_151806804_7fbe8b4e-aa8e-40dc-ab1a-fb27c0f8002c-hpSmall.jpg 163w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Focus Features</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-1eh6jm1 e134j7ei0"><a href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html">‘The Mustang’ Review: Where the Wild Things Roam. And Sometimes Break Out.</a></h2><p class="css-l8q78b e134j7ei1">This film is a seductively heartfelt melodrama about a violent inmate and a wild horse, brought together in a rehabilitation program to gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- href="/2019/03/15/movies/captain-marvel-goose.html">The ‘Captain Marvel’ Cat Was Actually Four Cats. Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- The dismissal prompted an outcry from the film franchise’s cast and fans.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Brooks Barnes</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-15cbhtu"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-k4k3gl e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/14mustang-1-thumbLarge.jpg 150w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo225-v2.jpg 225w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo440-v2.jpg 440w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/merlin_151806804_7fbe8b4e-aa8e-40dc-ab1a-fb27c0f8002c-hpSmall.jpg 163w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Focus Features</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-1eh6jm1 e134j7ei0"><a href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html">‘The Mustang’ Review: Where the Wild Things Roam. And Sometimes Break Out.</a></h2><p class="css-l8q78b e134j7ei1">This film is a seductively heartfelt melodrama about a violent inmate and a wild horse, brought together in a rehabilitation program to gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- href="/2019/03/15/movies/captain-marvel-goose.html">The ‘Captain Marvel’ Cat Was Actually Four Cats. Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- The dismissal prompted an outcry from the film franchise’s cast and fans.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Brooks Barnes</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-15cbhtu"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-k4k3gl e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/14mustang-1-thumbLarge.jpg 150w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-videoLarge-v2.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo225-v2.jpg 225w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/15mustang-1-mediumThreeByTwo440-v2.jpg 440w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/15/arts/15mustang-1/merlin_151806804_7fbe8b4e-aa8e-40dc-ab1a-fb27c0f8002c-hpSmall.jpg 163w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1hhnwbi e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Focus Features</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-1eh6jm1 e134j7ei0"><a href="/2019/03/14/movies/the-mustang-review.html">‘The Mustang’ Review: Where the Wild Things Roam. And Sometimes Break Out.</a></h2><p class="css-l8q78b e134j7ei1">This film is a seductively heartfelt melodrama about a violent inmate and a wild horse, brought together in a rehabilitation program to gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span both an imagined universe and a taste of the wider universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- href="/2019/03/15/movies/captain-marvel-goose.html">The ‘Captain Marvel’ Cat Was Actually Four Cats. Here’s How That Worked.</a></h2><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Reggie took the lead, the rambunctious Archie stepped in for scratching, Gonzo could be held, and Rizzo was a backup. Training them wasn’t as hard as you’d think.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Bruce Fretts</span></span></p></div></article>, <article class="css-imuvyx"><figure aria-label="media" class="photo css-1bto01c e1oaj3zl0" role="group"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Photo</span><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg" srcset="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-videoLarge.jpg 768w, https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/17climax-dance1-mediumThreeByTwo440.jpg 440w"/></a><figcaption class="css-aqbich e1oaj3zl1" itemprop="caption description"><span class="css-1nk1g0h e1oaj3zl2" itemprop="copyrightHolder"><span class="css-1dv1kvn">Credit</span>Laurent Lufroy and Fabien Sarfati/A24</span></figcaption></figure><div class="css-10wtrbd"><h2 class="css-171kk9w e4e4i5l1"><a data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html">When Extremes Attract: Dance and Horror’s New Pas de Deux</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/arts/dance/dance-and-horror-climax-gaspar-noe.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" src="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/03/18/arts/17climax-dance1/merlin_151112136_cf16684f-d511-4115-bc61-c236338f7e69-thumbStandard.jpg"/></a></div><p class="css-1gh531 e4e4i5l4">Gaspar Noé’s “Climax” is the latest movie to push the ecstatic, frightening qualities of dance into horror. A body holds plenty of space for terror.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- of Superhero Hits</a></h2><div class="css-ajkwsy"><a aria-hidden="true" data-rref="" href="/2019/03/17/movies/captain-marvel-box-office.html" tabindex="-1"><img alt="" tickets this weekend and is already the 13th-best-selling film in the 21-movie Marvel Cinematic Universe.</p><p class="css-1lwiyax e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp And Sometimes Break Out.</a></h2><p class="css-l8q78b e134j7ei1">This film is a seductively heartfelt melodrama about a violent inmate and a wild horse, brought together in a rehabilitation program to gentle each other.</p><p class="css-1o23gcr e4e4i5l2"><span class="css-me3p27"></span><span class="css-1dydysp e4e4i5l3"></span><span class="css-9voj2j" itemprop="author">By<!-- --> <span class="css-1baulvz" itemprop="name">Manohla Dargis</span></span></p></div></article>]
